column4: I tried to install the ATI accelerated graphics driver, but when I rebooted I was greeted by nothing but a black screen. Anyone know why this could be?
go to the ATi website intall latest drivers
Is the driver suggested by Ubuntu not updated, then?
trust me. envy sucks with video stuff for ATi
and the accelerated driver without envy is up to date
but you dont have the driver. just the accelerator
Would the latest driver allow dual monitors?
are you using linux 32bit or 64 bit?
right click on the file when it is done downloading, hit properties, permissions, look down at check allow executing file as program
open up terminal, type in sudo and drag the .run file into the terminal window
